intro: Mukia micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered mukia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, particularly India and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and opposite, elliptical leaves. It often grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Mukia micrantha is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
